Text saved: An important idea for the Hunger Games book came from Suzanne's love of old Greek stories. When she was a child, one of her favourite stories was about a hero called Theseus and a monster called the Minotaur. In this story, the city of Athens was ruled by another place called Crete, but the people of Athens fought against their rulers. As a punishment, the king of Crete made the people of Athens send seven boys and seven girls to Crete every year. These young people were put into a special maze and eaten by the Minotaur, which was a monster that lived there. However, one of the young men, whose name was Theseus, fought the Minotaur and killed it. Suzanne Collins thinks that Katniss Everdeen is like a modern Theseus from the future.
